meanings.definition: A wasteful or impractical project or activity.
meanings.sent1: The company's team-building retreat turned into a boondoggle when they spent the entire day playing games instead of working.
meanings.sent2: The government's new initiative to build a giant statue turned out to be a complete boondoggle, costing taxpayers millions of dollars.
meanings.sent3: The family's attempt to build a treehouse turned into a boondoggle when they realized they didn't have the right tools.
meanings.sent4: The school's fundraising event became a boondoggle when the main organizer forgot to book the venue.
meanings.sent5: The construction project quickly turned into a boondoggle when the workers realized they had the wrong blueprints.

meanings.definition: To waste time or money on unnecessary or frivolous activities.
meanings.sent1: Instead of studying for the exam, he chose to boondoggle by watching TV all day.
meanings.sent2: She always manages to boondoggle her time by getting lost in social media.
meanings.sent3: The group decided to boondoggle their afternoon away by going on a spontaneous road trip.
meanings.sent4: He realized he had been boondoggling his savings on unnecessary gadgets.
meanings.sent5: The team leader warned them not to boondoggle their resources on unimportant tasks.
